title: Bug 49536: Returning 200 OK with no content instead of 404 when accessing a URL with no webapps deployed
description: When accessing a URL with no webapps deployed in Tomcat 7, the server returns a HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of an HTTP error 404.
OB: If a Tomcat 7 instance is started with no webapps deployed and a URL is accessed, the server returns a HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
EB: When a URL is accessed with no webapps deployed in Tomcat 7, the server should return an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource was not found.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Download Tomcat 7 from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
3. Access a URL in the Tomcat server.
4. The server should return an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource was not found.
